questions.question: What is the primary raw material used to make glass?
questions.answer: Sand

questions.question: Which chemicals are mixed with sand to make glass?
questions.answer: Soda and lime

questions.question: What happens to the mixture when it is heated in a furnace?

options.text: It turns into hot, liquid glass

questions.answer: It turns into hot, liquid glass

questions.question: What is the property of glass that means it breaks easily?
questions.answer: Brittle

questions.question: When must glass be shaped?

options.text: When it is cold and hard
When it is still hot and soft
When it is in sand form

questions.answer: When it is still hot and soft

questions.question: What does 'impermeable' mean in relation to glass?

options.text: It does not allow liquids to pass through

questions.answer: It does not allow liquids to pass through

questions.question: Glass has no effect on the taste of food because it does not ______ any smell or taste.
questions.answer: Impart

questions.question: How much of glass is recyclable?
Recycling one glass bottle saves enough energy to power a TV for how long?
questions.answer: 20 minutes

questions.question: Where are 'stained glass windows' mostly seen?
questions.answer: Churches

questions.question: What is molten glass floated on to make flat sheets of even thickness?
questions.answer: A bed of molten metal

questions.question: Which of these can be made from hot liquid glass?
questions.answer: Glass wool

questions.question: According to the text, what can be used to produce coloured glass?
questions.answer: Different combinations of chemicals

questions.question: Words that show action are known as ______.
questions.answer: Verbs

questions.question: In the sentence 'She was tired', the verb describes a ______.
questions.answer: State

questions.question: What is the QR code for Chapter 13?
Recycling glass is ______ than making new glass from raw materials.
questions.answer: Much cheaper

questions.question: Glass that can be seen through is called ______.
questions.answer: Transparent

questions.question: Gobs of hot liquid glass can be ______ into bottles.
questions.answer: Blown

questions.question: Why is glass used to make so many things?
questions.answer: It is beautiful and useful

questions.question: What is glass made from?
questions.answer: Glass is made from sand.

questions.question: Name three chemicals used in making glass.
questions.answer: The chemicals used are sand, soda, and lime.

questions.question: What happens when hot liquid glass cools down?
questions.answer: When it cools down, it becomes stiff and hard.

questions.question: Why is it not possible to shape glass once it is cold?
questions.answer: It is not possible to shape it because it becomes cold, stiff, and hard.

questions.question: What does 'brittle' mean?
questions.answer: Brittle means that a material breaks easily.

questions.question: List four things you can do with hot liquid glass to shape it.
questions.answer: You can pour it, mould it, roll it, press it, or even blow it.

questions.question: How are flat sheets of even thickness made?
questions.answer: They are made by floating molten glass on a bed of molten metal.

questions.question: What are thin fibres made of glass called?
questions.answer: They are called glass wool.

questions.question: Mention two properties of glass mentioned in the text.
questions.answer: Glass is transparent and strong.

questions.question: Why doesn't glass get soggy?
questions.answer: Glass doesn't get soggy because it is impermeable.

questions.question: What does it mean when we say glass doesn't 'impart' a taste?
questions.answer: It means it doesn't give or add its own smell or taste to the food stored in it.

questions.question: Is ordinary glass coloured?
questions.answer: No, ordinary glass is colourless.

questions.question: List five colours mentioned that glass can be given.
questions.answer: Glass can be blue, ruby red, amber, dark green, or violet.

questions.question: What are stained glass windows?
questions.answer: They are windows made of coloured glass forming beautiful pictures.

questions.question: Where are stained glass windows commonly found?
questions.answer: They are seen mostly in churches.

questions.question: Can we paint on glass?
questions.answer: Yes, it is possible to paint on glass using special chemicals.

questions.question: Is glass 100% recyclable?
questions.answer: Yes, glass is 100% recyclable.

questions.question: Why is recycling glass better than making new glass?
questions.answer: It is cheaper and requires much less heat and energy.

questions.question: How much energy do you save by recycling one bottle?
questions.answer: You save enough energy to power a colour TV for about 20 minutes.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'molten'?
questions.answer: Molten means heated to a very high temperature until it becomes liquid.

questions.question: Define a 'verb'.
questions.answer: A verb is a word or group of words that shows action or a state.

questions.question: Give two examples of action verbs from the text.
questions.answer: Examples include 'pour' and 'mould'.

questions.question: Give an example of a verb showing a 'state'.
questions.answer: In the sentence 'She was tired', 'was' describes a state.

questions.question: What does a sentence with a verb express?
questions.answer: It expresses a complete thought or idea.

questions.question: What does it mean if a material is 'transparent'?
questions.answer: It means you can see through it.

questions.question: How is hot liquid glass poured into shapes?
questions.answer: It is poured into moulds and hardened.

questions.question: List three items made of glass mentioned in the intro.
questions.answer: Light bulbs, bottles, and jars are mentioned.

questions.question: Can glass be recycled more than once?
questions.answer: Yes, old glass can be used to make new glass any number of times.

questions.question: Why is glass used to store food?
questions.answer: Because it has no effect on the food stored in it.

questions.question: What is the slogan used in the pointers to encourage careful use of glass?
questions.answer: The slogan is 'Handle Glass with Care!'.
